website_summaries.verdict: The best aftermarket car alarm system to install at an affordable price.
pros: Car alarm system features a built-in shock sensor to detect attempts of tampering
Bright blue status LED warns thieves
Remote includes a panic button and activation/deactivation switches
cons: Included documentation is difficult to read and follow when first learning the system

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm the only thing that bothers me is that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great alarm the only thing that bothers me is that you cant be no more than 20 foot away from the truck to work If I’m inside my house and try to activate the alarm it doesn’t work you practically have to be in front or in site
customer_reviews.author: danny portillo

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy From This Supplier
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE I purchased this alarm a while ago and when I took it to my Alarm installer He said it was missing the (Onboard Dual Stage Zone 2 Impact Sensor). I contacted this Supplier and let them no about the situation. They never even got back to me. This just proves to me that all they care about is making a Dollar and not worried about their customers. Like the old saying goes when you do a good job, they will tell 20 people, but if you do a lousy job like this supplier, people will tell 500 people. So my suggestion is Stay Away From This Supplier
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Deathe

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units; one I wired up to just be an alarm, no flashing lights, no sensors other than the shock sensor in the control module. The alarm started malfunctioning in short order and I returned the other one. I didn't want to take a chance on another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Bates

customer_reviews.title: Works great found out three of my door actuators aren’t working ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great found out three of my door actuators aren’t working properly. Other than that, not to sensitive, doors lock when ignition turns on, doors unlock when ignition turns off. 1999 Chevy Suburban
customer_reviews.author: Jibri

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for myself and one for my brother. After a littler research, I was able to do both of them myself. I only have a basic understanding of 12v, so if I can do it anyone can. As long as you do your research first, its fairly easy, and will save you hundreds in install fees. Alarms work great, had mine for 6 months now and it has never false alarmed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it was to install. Works good. Door locks power from alarm was working but then it stopped working. Other than that everything work awesome
customer_reviews.author: henry arteaga

customer_reviews.title: car alarm
customer_reviews.text: i have a 2001 Honda CRV in awesome condition, to keep prying hands off of it i bought this viper alarm system, so far so good. now i have peace of mind, also has a starter kill built in.
customer_reviews.author: batman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic
customer_reviews.text: Its a basic alarm. Wiring isn't hard, you just have to do your research and see your wiring diagram for your car.
customer_reviews.author: Kiem Dang

customer_reviews.title: Brain is not Viper
customer_reviews.text: A bit deceiving that they are selling us a viper 3400v but the only thing viper is the box and the remotes. The main computer is a Directed Electronics 3100 which is same as Avital. The horn/siren is so small and quiet. Did come with 2x viper stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Soeperman

customer_reviews.title: Check inside the box!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and took it to an expert to install it just to find out it wasn’t even a viper alarm inside but only the box and control were viper. I had to pay the guy extra to get the THAT alarm reprogrammed to that control and I had to pay extra. Really disssappinted I with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hector F.

customer_reviews.title: bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Had my electronics guy install so for me install was easy lol! I love having locks that work for once! I just wish it was a little louder!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not good.
customer_reviews.text: We had to search You Tube videos to be able to install. Have a professional do it, if you have doubts
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It wasn’t too hard to instal, only thing that gave me trouble was my vehicle wiring harness, other than that it’s amazing. The LED is bright. The siren is loud. Over 20ft & still lock, unlocks & sounds when hitting panic. It’s very well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Julio aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Installation took just about an hour, had a professional do it just to be safe. Works excellent thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Heetai

customer_reviews.title: Very good system
customer_reviews.text: Excellent setup. Installed in a 2018 ford e350 cutaway van with power locks but didnt have keyless entry and installation was very straight forward. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Not the best viper alarm
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous year model viper installed in another car, and this one, which is a newer model is lacking. The arm/disarm range is remarkably smaller, the siren is quieter and the features on a whole are also less.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.text: HOOKED IT UP AND WAS SURPRISED WITH THE HOOD CLOSED I COULD BARELY HEAR THE AUDIBLE.. I RETURNED THE ITEM AND ORDERED SOMETHING A LITTLE BIT MORE PROFESSIONALLY BUILT
customer_reviews.author: WhenInDoubtSpellItOut

customer_reviews.title: Protect your investment!
customer_reviews.text: I can sleep in peace knowing my car is covered!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Doing the job
customer_reviews.text: Went with a basic install since you need other parts for the key less entry. Had it installed and its working like it should
customer_reviews.author: Brandon murphy

customer_reviews.title: basic
customer_reviews.text: basic alarm keyless entry no usses, just one con; the range is not that far
customer_reviews.author: JuanPenaloza

customer_reviews.title: Not authentic Viper Alarm
customer_reviews.text: Not a authentic viper, it has the brain of an avital; does not come with the wired antenna that goes in the windshield. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ervin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not an alarm
customer_reviews.text: this is not an alarm, has no horn or siren. just keyless entry with options of ignition kill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than stellar
customer_reviews.text: No body vibration sensor, advertised remote distance is overrated, flimsy warning LED.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ALARM SYSTEM
customer_reviews.text: Product was EXACTLY as advertised I advise whoever that is thinking about getting this alarm to hurry and SNATCH IT UP!!
customer_reviews.author: Shuntel E.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Its very light. The button. Barely have to press it. And works good so far.
customer_reviews.author: joy valdes

customer_reviews.title: Viper good product
customer_reviews.text: Viper alarm simply the best protection for any car or truck
customer_reviews.author: Johnny camacho

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: it took over 4 hours to install, had to get a module.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with the step by step wiring instructions
customer_reviews.text: Viper is always a quality product.The reason for the three stars has nothing to do with the product itself, but moreso the after sales service. I was a bit disappointed to discover that this unit did not include a detailed installation guide. The guide is available on the viper site to registered auto installers and dealers. I had to call the help line and endure the wait ,and be at the mercy of the representative to obtain such a guide. Finally I did and all is now well. The unit is wonderful, but you may want to obtain it from an authorised dealer who can log you in to the site.
customer_reviews.author: Auto Repair Plus

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to big boys toys.
customer_reviews.text: Manuals that came with it is sketchy, ambiguous grammar at best, and worse, most net links are all dead or non-existent. Nevertheless, I had an old-school, dealership electrician install this on my new used vehicle and so far, works better than the stock alarm that was installed.
customer_reviews.author: sapperick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this alarm 6 months and had it professionally installed. One day it the siren would sound when I turned on the lights when the car is running. Then eventually it just stopped working. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAndCyn

customer_reviews.title: Great deal must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Viper3400v 3 channel 1way car alarm works great in all my cars. Instructions are very clear and easy to understand some wires don't do exactly what you would expect but from viper it's still great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: I'm on the fence about it
customer_reviews.text: It installed easy and hooked up with no problem. The only problem I have is I can't get the shock sensor to trigger the alarm. I guess I'm not adjusting it right. I'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Ted M Zaremba

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm system for the money!
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this for his car and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Crazycatlady93

customer_reviews.title: Working
customer_reviews.text: Easy and stuff for me works great great value if you do not know how to wire your car download a wire color coeordinate diagram
customer_reviews.author: michael villa

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to check everything before starting the install!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a model 3400V, received a model 3100 in a 3400V box and it's missing a wiring harness!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: It works very well a little hard to understand the installation information but doable
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW IRVIN

customer_reviews.title: Careful not as stated in the product description
customer_reviews.text: Item came opened, seemed it was either used or returned. Should not be sold as new. I will comment on the product once it is installed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Viper 350 PLUS 3105V 1-Way Car Alarm Keyless Entry,BLACK
product_meta.description: Style:2015 MODELViper has long been the industry standard for quality vehicle security and remote start systems, and for good reason. Viper has led the way in innovative security technology from their top of the line systems to their solid entry level systems and the 3105V is no exception. With a FailSafe starter kill system and Anti-Carjacking mode, you can be sure that would be thieves wont be going anywhere with your vehicle. You can even hook up a remote start to the Viper 350 Plus if you wanted to. The 3105V is one of our most popular alarm systems that we carry and it looks like it's going to stay that way for a long time so make sure you get yours today! Viper has long been the industry standard for quality vehicle security and remote start systems, and for good reason. Viper has led the way in innovative security technology from their top of the line systems to their solid entry level systems and the 3105V is no exception. With a FailSafe starter kill system and Anti-Carjacking mode, you can be sure that would be thieves wont be going anywhere with your vehicle. You can even hook up a remote start to the Viper 350 Plus if you wanted to. The 3105V is one of our most popular alarm systems that we carry and it looks like it's going to stay that way for a long time so make sure you get yours today! This shock sensor utilizes warning chirps for minor disturbances and will trip the alarm if it detects more serious impacts or disruptions. Most dual zone shock sensors have adjustable sensitivity to reduce false alarms or warnings. These sensors let would-be thieves know that your vehicle is equipped with an advanced alarm system and to keep away.
feature_bullets: 3-Channel 1-way Security System with Keyless Entry 4-Button remotes. Additional options include remote starter & GPS Tracking.
Revenger six-tone soft-chirp siren and parking light alarm response.
Bright blue status LED warns thieves and gives you info about the system

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars706 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
